question: Primary level of prevention is?
exp: Modes Primordial Before the emergence of risk factor Health education Primary Risk factor but no disease yet Health promotion, specific protection Secondary Disease possible staed in the body Early diagnosis, Treatment Teiary Disease is already in progression Disability limitation, Rehabilitation
opa: Prevention of emergence of risk factors
opb: Prevention of disease in Pre-pathogenesis phase
opc: Prevention of disease in incipient stage

question: 'Monitoring of BP' is an example for:-
exp: - Secondary Level of Prevention is applied when disease has possibly set in. - So, monitoring of BP after hypertension has already set in accounts to secondary level of prevention. Levels of prevention Level Aim Modes Primordial prevention Prevention of emergence of development of risk factors Health education Primary prevention Action taken prior to the onset of disease Health promotion specific protection Secondary prevention Action which halts the progress of a disease Early diagnosis and treatment, screening programmes Teiary prevention Measures to reduce impairments and disabilities Disability limitation, rehabilitation

question: PAP smear is used for screening of Cervical cancer. It is classified under which level of prevention:-
exp: Screening & diagnostic tests comes under Secondary level of prevention. Secondary prevention - It halts the progress of disease at its incipient stage and prevent complication. Level Aim Modes Primordial prevention Prevention of emergence of development of risk factors Health education Primary prevention Action taken prior to the onset of disease Health promotion specific protection Secondary prevention Action which halts the progress of a disease Early diagnosis and treatment, Screening programmes Teiary prevention Measures to reduce impairments and disabilities Disability limitation, Rehabilitation

question: 'Mobile eye clinics' is an example for:-
exp: - Mobile eye clinics may conduct camps in villages where facilities are not much available. - They conduct screening & diagnostic tests & gives treatment accordingly. - As early diagnosis & treatment comes under 2nd level of prevention, answer is option-3.

question: Primary prevention in myocardial infarction are all EXCEPT:
exp: - All screening & diagnostic tests comes under secondary level of prevention. - Hence, Screening for hypertension is a secondary level of prevention. It aims to reduce the prevalence of a disease by shoening its duration. - All other options given protects against development of MI. Hence, primary level of prevention.

question: Secondary level of prevention include all of the following except:-
exp: Secondary level of prevention: - Disease has possibly set in the body; Early diagnosis & treatment should be done. - All screening & diagnostic tests comes under Secondary level of prevention. - Hence, health screening for diabetes mellitus, case finding for falciparum malaria and contact tracing for STIs represent Secondary level of prevention. - Reconstructive surgery in leprosy aims to rehabilitate the patient; thus it is a form of Teiary level of prevention.

question: Which of the following is not true regarding Pathogenesis of a disease?
exp: - Pathogenesis phase of disease: Begins with entry of the disease 'agent' in the susceptible host. Multiplication of organism, disease initiation and progression is seen. Final outcome may be recovery, disability or death. Secondary and teiary levels of prevention are possible here. Screening of disease may improve prognosis and increase survival. (Hence, option-1 is wrong)
opa: Screening is of no use in changing course of disease.

question: Which of the following is Primordial prevention?
exp: LEVELS OF PREVENTION: Primordial prevention Prevention of emergence of development of risk factors Done by health education. Primary prevention Action taken prior to the onset of disease Done by health promotion & specific protection. Secondary prevention Action which halts the progress of a disease Done by early diagnosis & treatment Teiary prevention Action taken during the progression/ end of disease Done by diability limitation & rehabilitation. - Note: All vaccines comes under primary level of prevention - specific protection. All screening & diagnostic tests comes under secondary level of prevention.
opa: Action taken prior to the onset of disease.
opb: Prevention of emergence of development of risk factors.
opc: Action taken to remove the possibility that a disease will ever occur.
opd: Action that halts the progress of a disease.

question: The most cost-effective mode of intervention for prevention of disease is:
exp: Health education is one of the most cost- effective interventions. A large number of diseases could be prevented if people were adequately informed & if they were encouraged to take necessary precautions in time.

question: In a population to prevent Coronary aery disease, changing harmful lifestyles by education is referred to as:-
exp: Primary level of prevention: It is action taken prior to onset of disease, which removes the possibility that a disease will ever occur. It signifies 'Intervention in the Pre-pathogenesis phase of a disease / health problem'. Modes of Intervention: Health promotion- Targeted at strengthening the host through a variety of approaches / interventions, e. g. Environmental modifications, nutritional interventions etc. Specific protection: Targeted at prevention of a disease through specific prevention.

question: The installation and usage of sanitary latrines by general public constitutes which level of prevention?
exp: - Use of Sanitary latrines will result in general improvement of hygiene & prevention of multiple diseases. - Hence, it constitutes Health promotion which is primary level of prevention.

question: Example of disability limitation:-
exp: Disability Limitation:- Teiary level of prevention when patient repos late in pathogenesis phase. Prevent transition of disease from impairment to handicap. Spectacles in refractive error stabilizes visual acuity (Disability limitation) and provides visual clarity (Rehabilitation) too.

question: "Ottawa Chaer of Health Promotion" incorporates all of the following key action areas except:-
exp: Ottawa Chaer for Health Promotion - Five key action areas: Public health policy. Strengthen community action for health. Reorientation of health services. Personal skills development. Suppoive environment.

question: Which of the following is an example of disability limitation in poliomyelitis?
exp: Resting limbs in neutral position helps prevent over-stretching of paralyzed muscles, thereby limits fuher disability. Disability limitation- It's objective is to prevent or halt the transition of the disease process from impairment to handicap. Disability limitation & rehabilitation comes under teiary level of prevention.
opa: Reducing occurrence of polio by immunization
opb: Arranging for schooling of child suffering from PRPP
opc: Resting affected limbs in neutral position

question: Early ambulation after a major operation is an example of:
exp: Early ambulation after major operation is a protection against deep vein thrombosis, which helps in disability limitation. Teiary level of prevention- applied when disease has advanced beyond early stages. It aims to reduce or limit disabilities & help in rehabilitation. Rehabilitation is restoration of an individual to the highest possible level of functional ability.

question: National Iron Plus Initiative is an example of:-
exp: National Iron Plus Initiative is an attempt to work on Iron deficiency anemia, in which its beneficiaries will receive Iron and Folic acid supplementation irrespective of their iron / hemoglobin status. Thus its Primary level of prevention (Specific protection). Iron and folic acid supplementation is given as a prophylaxis and hence would be an example of primary prevention. In primary prevention, it is specific protection against Anemia. LEVELS OF PREVENTION: Primordial prevention Prevention of emergence of development of risk factors Done by health education. Primary prevention Action taken prior to the onset of disease Done by health promotion & specific protection. Secondary prevention Action which halts the progress of a disease Done by early diagnosis & treatment Teiary prevention Action taken during the progression/ end of disease Done by diability limitation & rehabilitation. - Note: All vaccines comes under primary level of prevention - specific protection. All screening & diagnostic tests comes under secondary level of prevention.

question: Vitamin A prophylaxisis is:-
exp: - Vitamin A Prophylaxis is given before the disease has occurred to children at-risk. So, it is a primary prevention. - Since, it is specific to prevention of Vitamin A deficiency blindness, it is specific protection. - All vaccines, prophylaxis comes under primary prevention i. e specific protection of the disease. Prophylactic dose- Under the new recent guidelines in NIS, vitamin -A is given: GROUP DOSE 6 months - 1 year of age 1 lakh IU orally 1 - 6 years of age 2 lakh IU orally All of the early stages of xerophthalmia can be reversed by administration of a massive dose (200, 000 IU or 110 mg ofretinol palmitate) orally on two successive days.

question: The use of condom for protection against sexually transmitted diseases qualifies as -
exp: This is an example of primary prevention since we are trying to prevent the occurrence of the disease though the risk factors are present. Since use of condom will provide protection only against STI and not other conditions, it is specific protection.
